2308860.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308860
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 001
2308860.text: Az-Zuhri reported that a man from Bali said, "I came to visit the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, with my father. My father spoke to him while I was not there. I said to my father, 'What did he say to you?' He replied, 'When you desire something, then you must proceed slowly until Allah shows you a way out of it or until Allah makes a way out for you.'"

2308870.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308870
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 002
2308870.text: Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyya said, "Not wise is he who does not deal correctly with a person whose company he cannot avoid until Allah appoints for him a release or a way out."

2308880.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308880
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 003
2308880.text: Al-Bara' ibn 'Azib related that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "If anyone gives a gift or guides down a land - or a path - that, for him, is equivalent to freeing a slave."

2308890.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308890
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 004
2308890.text: Abu Dharr is reported as saying, "Your putting some of the water from your bucket in your brother's bucket is sadaqa. Your removing stones. thorns and bones from people's path is sadaqa. Your guiding a man in a place where there are no guides is sadaqa."

2308900.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308900
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 005
2308900.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Allah curses anyone who misguides a blind person and leads him away from the path."

2308910.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308910
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 006
2308910.text: Ibn 'Abbas told Shahr (ibn Hawshab), "While the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was sitting in the courtyard of his house in Makka, 'Uthman ibn Maz'un passed by and smiled at the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to him, 'Why don't you sit down?' 'I will,' he said. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, sat facing him. While he was conversing with him, the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, stared at the sky and said, 'A messenger from Allah, 'Abdullah came to me just now when you sat sown?' He asked, 'What did he say to you?' He said, 'Allah commands justice and doing good and giving to relatives. And He forbids indecency and doing wrong and tyranny. He warns you so that hopefully you will pay heed.' (16:90) 'Uthman said, 'That was when belief was established in my heart and I loved Muhammad.'"

2308920.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308920
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 007
2308920.text: Anas reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I will enter the Garden with someone who brings up two daughters until they come of age, and we will be like these two," and he indicated his index finger and middle finger.

2308930.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308930
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 008

2308940.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308940
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 009
2308940.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The noble son of the noble son of the noble son of the noble one was Yusuf ibn Ya'qub ibn Ishaq ibn Ibrahim."

2308950.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308950
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 010
2308950.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "My friends on the Day of Rising will be those with taqwa, even if one lineage is closer than another. People will not bring me their actions. They will come carrying this world on their shoulders and they will call out, 'Muhammad!' I will say, 'no,' to such-and-such, and I will have full power over them."

2308960.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308960
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 011
2308960.text: 'Mankind! We created you from a male and a female, and made you into peoples and tribes so that you might come to know each other. The noblest among you in Allah's sight is the one with the most taqwa.' (49:13) One man says to another man, 'I am more noble than you are.' No one is nobler than another person except by taqwa."

2308970.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308970
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 012
2308970.text: Ibn 'Abbas said, "What do you reckon to be nobility? Allah has made nobility clear. The noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the one with the greatest taqwa. What do you reckon as lineage? The best of you in lineage is the best of you in character."

2308980.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308980
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 013
2308980.text: 'A'isha said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'The arwah are a massed army. When they already know each other, they are friendly. When they do not know each other, they disagree.'"

2308990.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2308990
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 014
2308990.text: Abu Hurayra reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The spirits are massed armies. Those of them that knew one another are friendly. Those that did not know one another disagree."

2309000.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2309000
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 015
2309000.text: Abu Hurayra said, "I heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'While a shepherd was tending to his sheep, a wolf came and snatched one of the sheep. The shepherd went after the wolf which turned to him and said, 'Who will look after them on the 'Day of Wild Beasts'? They will have no shepherd but me.' People said, 'Glory be to Allah!' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'I believe it - I, Abu Bakr and 'Umar.'"

2309010.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2309010
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 016
2309010.text: 'Ali said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was in a funeral procession an he picked up something and began to scratch the ground with it. He said, 'There is none of you who does not have his seat written either in the Fire or in the Garden.' They said, 'Messenger of Allah, then should we not rely on what is written for us and abandon action?' 'Act.' he said. 'Every thing is easy if you were created for it.' He added, 'As for someone who is one of the people of happiness, it is easy for him to perform the actions of happiness. As for someone who is one of the people of wretchedness, it is easy for him to perform the actions of wretchedness.' Then he recited, 'As for him who gives out and has taqwa and confirms the Good' (92:5-10)

2309020.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2309020
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 017
2309020.text: Usayd ibn Abi Usayd reported that his mother said, "I said to Abu Qatada, 'Why don't you relate something from the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace?' Abu Qatada said, 'I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Whoever tells lies about me, eases the way for himself to a bed in the Fire." When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said that, he began to wipe his hand on the ground.'"

2309030.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2309030
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 018
2309030.text: 'Abdullah ibn Mughaffal al-Muzani said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade slings. He said, 'They do not kill game nor injure the enemy. They gouge the eye and break the teeth.'"

2309040.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2309040
In-book reference  : Book 38, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 38, Hadith 019
2309040.text: Abu Hurayra said, "A fierce wind blew when the people were on the road to Makka while 'Umar was making hajj. 'Umar asked those around him, 'What is the wind?' They did not give any answer. I urged my camel forward and I caught up with him and said, 'I have heard that you asked about the wind. I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "The wind (reeh) is from the spirit (ruh) of Allah. It brings mercy and it brings punishment. Do not curse it. Ask Allah for the good of it and seek refuge from its evil."'"
